oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Framed memorial from the French government to the family of Pvt. Frank M. Ring
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Pvt. Frank M. Ring, Co. A, 114th MG Battn., 30th Div. was killed October 8, 1918. He was one of three brothers from Fanklin, Williamson County, Tennessee that served in WW I. His mother, Sarah Frances M. Ring, was one of the "gold star" mothers and wives who made a pilgrimage to France in the early 1930s to visit the American cemeteries. These pilgrimages were paid for the U.S. government.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
